title: All Disney resort quick-service restaurants to offer plant-based menu items next week
text: Walt Disney Co. DIS, +0.70% said Tuesday that starting next week, all "major" quick service restaurants at its Walt Disney World and Disneyland Resort will serve plant-based options. The company said the number of plant-based menu options will be more than 400. Among some of the plant-based items are steamed Asian dumplings from Le Cellier at Epcot, plant-based cashew cheesecake from California Grill at Disney's Contemporary Resort and Felucian Garden Spread made from plant-based "kefta" at Jungle Navigation Co. LTD Skipper Canteen at Magic Kingdom Park. Disney's stock, which rose 1.3% in premarket trading, has rallied 20.8% year to date through Monday, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.42% has advanced 15.5%.
